channel.title: Can the truth change?
channel.description:
Hello all. I have a quick question for you guys to answer. Do you believe that the truth can change?
Post why or why not. :P

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

A Million Little Pieces

A Million Little Pieces is a book by James Frey, originally sold as a memoir and later marketed as a semi-fictional novel following accusations of literary forgery. It tells the story of a 23-year-old alcoholic and drug abuser and how he copes with rehabilitation in a twelve steps-oriented treatment center. While initially promoted as a memoir, it was later discovered that many of the events described in the book never happened. A badly tattered James awakens on an airplane to Chicago, with no ...

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

jme:

What you’re asking is much too vague.

Absolute truth? No, that never changes. If that’s what you’re trying to ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

jme:

one can not simply choose or change x in x + 5 = 7, it can only be 2

If you want it to be a true statement, yes, the only option is 2.

But like I’ve said, if it’s anything other than 2, it evaluates as false.

Thus showing that changing a variable can easily change whether something is true or false.

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?

item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

of course it can change

-le dates a fat chick in high school
-le asks me if this dress makes her look fat, I say maybe just a little, I get slapped
-le loses wait
-le asks me again if dress makes her look fat, I say its all in your hips, still gets slaps

I just don’t understand women

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Venomous`, post:22, topic:466061”]I think it’s hard to say that truth changes or doesn’t change at all.

For example, I open a window.
The truth is that the window is open.
If I close it…
The truth is that the window is closed.[/quote]
But it becomes true that you did open the window at some point in time

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

jme:

While it’ll always be true that months ago, she had a yeast infection, it is no longer true that she has one now(after treatment was complete anyways).

The truth never changes, it only changes tenses. Now it is true she had a yeast infection but that no longer applies in the current point in time.

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:18, topic:466061”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=575055.msg4145056#msg4145056 date=1352162439]
You can easily show this with math, take this equation.

x + 5 = 7

Now, if x is 2, this equation results as true. However, if x is 1, 5+1 is 6, not 7, therefor making it false.

You may be thinking how this shows it, well, like I said in an earlier reply, if you change one of the variables, it can determine whether or not something evaluates as true or false. In a real life scenario, something can be true for the time being, it can change if one of the variables change. I’m not saying that it always changes if a variable changes, but it’s easily possibly for the truth to ‘change’.
[/quote]
That is a conditional statement that consists of a variable. Nothing is proven until x is revealed.[/quote]

Yes but the point I’m trying to get across is that whether or not it evaluates to true or false can rely on variables being changed.

Read full topic

You may be thinking how this shows it, well, like I said in an earlier reply, if you change one of the variables, it can determine whether or not something evaluates as true or false. In a real life scenario, something can be true for the time being, it can change if one of the variables change. I’m not saying that it always changes if a variable changes, but it’s easily possibly for the truth to ‘change’.[/quote]
That is a conditional statement that consists of a variable. Nothing is proven until x is revealed.

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

You can easily show this with math, take this equation.

x + 5 = 7

Now, if x is 2, this equation results as true. However, if x is 1, 5+1 is 6, not 7, therefor making it false.

You may be thinking how this shows it, well, like I said in an earlier reply, if you change one of the variables, it can determine whether or not something evaluates as true or false. In a real life scenario, something can be true for the time being, it can change if one of the variables change. I’m not saying that it always changes if a variable changes, but it’s easily possibly for the truth to ‘change’.

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:14, topic:466061”]Ok than here is another way to put it

So this hooker has a yeast infection. She tells her client the truth “I’ve got a yeast infection/smells like trout”

The hooker eventually buys some Vagisil (albeit months later since she only made enough for her crack addiction). Near the end of treatment, the yeast bacteria are in small numbers and her twat doesn’t smell anymore. The same client is back for more. She tells him the truth, “I still have the infection but the smell is gone, now you can DATY”

lol

While it’ll always be true that months ago, she had a yeast infection, it is no longer true that she has one now(after treatment was complete anyways).

you can safely ignore my argument, just wanted to talk about stinky hooker vaginas in a boring topic.[/quote]
The truth is that you need to pay your hookers more. This will stay the truth forever. Nothing will change the fact that you underpaid your hookers before the 6. of November 2012.

[quote=“tyb97, post:15, topic:466061”][quote author=Frell link=topic=575055.msg4144951#msg4144951 date=1352158222]

Perhaps the truth is, you never get laid because you’re ugly and weak.

Or you’re ripped as fuck with slight social anxiety
[/quote]
Definition for Frell.[/quote]
How much do you think Frell would get if he started to sell sex?

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?

item.description:
@jme wrote:

Ok than here is another way to put it

So this hooker has a yeast infection. She tells her client the truth “I’ve got a yeast infection/smells like trout”

The hooker eventually buys some Vagisil (albeit months later since she only made enough for her crack addiction). Near the end of treatment, the yeast bacteria are in small numbers and her twat doesn’t smell anymore. The same client is back for more. She tells him the truth, “I still have the infection but the smell is gone, now you can DATY”

lol

While it’ll always be true that months ago, she had a yeast infection, it is no longer true that she has one now(after treatment was complete anyways).

you can safely ignore my argument, just wanted to talk about stinky hooker vaginas in a boring topic.

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:9, topic:466061”]What you’re asking is much too vague.

Perhaps the truth is, you never get laid because you’re ugly and weak. Well, this wouldn’t be the truth anymore if you paid a hooker. Now the truth is that you’re ugly but getting laid by hookers. I suppose the truth has changed.

The fact that I ate 2 banana’s and yogurt for breakfast Nov 5 2012 will always remain true.

tl:dr the past doesn’t change. Anything else can.

Below is a lie
Above is true[/quote]
No, because the idea that you are “ugly”, is an opinion, and cannot be proven fact.

The truth cannot change, if you shot somebody yesterday. You did it yesterday. It’s still true today. It’s gonna be true for the rest of eternity, doesn’t change.

Read full topic

item.title: Can the truth change?
item.dc:creator: @Venomous Venomous`
item.description:
@Venomous wrote:

I’ve realized I’ve been much to vague. :rolleyes:
Truth = The real state of things, or the agreement between fact and reality.

This can relate with nearly anything.

Read full topic
